Package org.daiitech.naftah.parser

Class NaftahErrorListener

java.lang.Object
org.antlr.v4.runtime.BaseErrorListener
org.daiitech.naftah.parser.NaftahErrorListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.antlr.v4.runtime.ANTLRErrorListener
public class NaftahErrorListener extends org.antlr.v4.runtime.BaseErrorListener
Custom error listener for Naftah language parsing errors.

This listener extends ANTLR's BaseErrorListener and provides custom error messages in Arabic with enhanced formatting for better developer feedback. It translates common syntax errors, provides detailed error locations (line, column), and handles special cases like unexpected end-of-file (EOF).

On encountering a syntax error, it formats and prints the error message, then throws a ParseCancellationException to halt interpretation.

Singleton instance: INSTANCE Error strategy: ERROR_HANDLER_INSTANCE

Author:
Chakib Daii

    • syntaxError

      public void syntaxError(org.antlr.v4.runtime.Recognizer<?,?> recognizer, Object offendingSymbol, int line, int charPositionInLine, String msg, org.antlr.v4.runtime.RecognitionException e)
      Called by ANTLR when a syntax error is encountered during parsing. It formats the error message, translates common error phrases into Arabic, highlights the offending token, and displays expected tokens for EOF errors. Then it throws a ParseCancellationException to stop parsing.
      Specified by:
      syntaxError in interface org.antlr.v4.runtime.ANTLRErrorListener
      Overrides:
      syntaxError in class org.antlr.v4.runtime.BaseErrorListener
      Parameters:
      recognizer - the parser instance
      offendingSymbol - the symbol/token where the error occurred
      line - the line number of the error (1-based)
      charPositionInLine - the character position within the line (0-based)
      msg - the error message provided by ANTLR
      e - the exception thrown by the parser (can be null)
